Expectation1: Teaching children moral values and discipline
Situation1: The child is caught stealing snacks at a store, and the father needs to handle the situation
Expectation2: Review and analyze legal documents and contracts
Situation2: A purchase agreement needs analysis before an upcoming filing deadline that is drawing nearer.
Story: I was standing in the kitchen, my laptop open and legal documents spread across the table, when my phone rang. It was the store manager, his voice tense as he explained that my son had been caught slipping a candy bar into his pocket. My heart dropped. As a father, I knew I needed to teach him about honesty and consequences, to guide him with patience and discipline. But as a lawyer, I was painfully aware of the looming deadline—the purchase agreement on my screen needed my full attention, and any mistake could cost my client dearly. My mind raced, torn between the urgent need to be present for my son, to help him understand the gravity of his actions, and the professional obligation to deliver flawless work under pressure. I could feel the weight of both worlds pressing in, each demanding more than I felt able to give.
